etymology.description: 由(由) (yóu, "battle helmet") + 皮(皮) (pí, "pelt") = to defeat or vanquish -> 克(克)
etymology.interpretation: The character 克(克) (kè) illustrates the concept of overcoming an opponent in battle, symbolized by the combination of a helmet and a pelt. Alternatively, it can depict a person carrying a load, signifying the ability to bear or undertake tasks competently.

examples.chinese: 这瓶药含50克(這瓶藥含50克)。
examples.english: This bottle of medicine contains 50 grams.

examples.chinese: 他克服困难(他克服困難)，迈向成功(邁向成功)。
examples.pinyin: Tā kèfú kùnnán, mài xiàng chénggōng.
examples.english: He overcame difficulties and stepped towards success.

examples.chinese: 她决心克敌制胜(她決心克敵制勝)，面对挑战(面對挑戰)。
examples.pinyin: Tā juéxīn kè dí zhì shèng, miànduì tiǎozhàn.
examples.english: She is determined to overcome her enemies and triumph when facing challenges.
